title: "How Did Donato Make His Subjects Forget Their Own Names?"
first_phrase: In this mesmerizing experiment, Donato showcases his increasing control over the body and mind of his subjects. He has already induced aphonia and muteness in his previous trials by paralyzing specific muscles. In the last part of the experiment, Donato attempts to wipe out the subject's memory of their name by manipulating their brain. The subject, Mr. Tanner, responds to the experiment by forgetting his name briefly, only to recall it after a considerable effort. Donato then moves on to test another subject, Mr. Coindet, by challenging him to resist his commands. It is a remarkable display of hypnosis that showcases the power of the human mind in this intriguing experiment.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the power of suggestion and the influence of a strong will can lead to extraordinary demonstrations such as those witnessed in these experiments. However, it is crucial to remember that every person's reaction may vary, and it is essential to approach any kind of influence or hypnosis with caution and under the supervision of trained professionals.
